website_summaries.verdict: Easy-to-assemble tetherball set will have you playing your first game in almost no time.
pros: Plastic PVC ground sleeve allows you to pull the pole out of the ground for storage as needed
3-piece pole is easy to connect and set up
Pole has more than 10-feet of height
Powder-coated pole stands up to the weather
cons: Some parts won't stand up to stress

customer_reviews.title: 💓 Great Tetherball Set
customer_reviews.text: This tetherball set is well-made, sturdy, easy to assemble, and a great price! Kit comes with everything you need, even the little pump to inflate the ball. Great add-on item! Packaged nicely, and arrived quickly. We sent ours up a little bit differently, we filled a 3 gallon bucket with cement, put a steel pole that was about 4 ft tall in the center and left cure. (the steel pole that was inserted in the cement was a little larger than the tetherball pole, make sure it is a good fit and not to small or the Tetherball will not be stable) After the cement dried, we dug a hole just big enough to bury the bucket. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: I Moon Garden

customer_reviews.title: Good quality set for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Kids have been playing with this every day since we got it. I haven't had a chance to concrete in the base yes, but we dug it down deep. Our soil is pretty loose and rocky, so it does come loose when they really play hard, but we're going to create a concrete base for it with a bucket or tire - there are lots of videos on youtube on how to do that. Honestly, this set has been really awesome for the price, and it's not a big deal tamp the dirt down better when it starts to wiggle. Good quality set - better than I was expecting for the price! Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: K. Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Broke by an 8 year old in 2 Days, Pole is unstable
customer_reviews.text: My husband cemented it in the ground. The pole was loose between the base mount and joints. It swayed a lot when my kids played. My son received this on his birthday on 6/21. It was mounted on 6/25. After playing for two days the eye pin/hook broke on top (by my 8 year old) and it is already out of commission until we find new parts Since we’ve already cemented it.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: If they just would have spent a little more on the supplies
customer_reviews.text: Still working on getting it up and going. I was disappointed that the black base piece is plastic. Why would that make any sense to have a plastic pipe holding a metal pole? I tried to find metal to replace it and it’s such an odd size that Lowe’s or local hardware stores don’t have any- closest is 2” which is too big for the pole and makes it wobbly.
customer_reviews.author: familyfarm275

customer_reviews.title: It’s fun for the whole family
customer_reviews.text: My grandchildren and their friends are having a blast playing tether ball. Also it is a joy to see them having fun playing outside instead of watching television or being on some type of smart phone, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Not super durable...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace a 20yr old tetherball set at my parents home. The set assembles and installs easily. It looks really nice, but every time I visit my parents the ball and string are on the ground because the bolt holding them on has come off again. (We have 10-12 yr olds using the set) My dad is going to go buy a lock nut to try to hold the i-bolt in place because the way that it is assembled does not hold up...which really stinks considering how much the set cost.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Horak

customer_reviews.title: what a great time the grands are having with this
customer_reviews.text: Wow, what a great time the grands are having with this. We put it in a tire with cement so they could move it around easily. Great quality and easily put together.
customer_reviews.author: kit

customer_reviews.title: NOT STURDY - Poor quality ball
customer_reviews.text: POOR Quality. After playing with this tetherball set for ONLY 3 weeks (we just set it up), and NOT EVERY DAY either, the clip ripped away from the ball. I paid over $100 for this set and expected better quality. We replaced it with the Champion tetherball and hope it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Believe it or not, we bought this for our dog!
customer_reviews.text: After other boxer owners posted videos of their dogs playing with a tetherball, we thought, "Why not?" OMG! He loves it! We l recently lost our other dog, so poor Skully didn't have a playmate. The tetherball keeps him active and my husband, who has mobility issues, isn't get hurt playing with the dog. A win/win for our household!
customer_reviews.author: Gatorblu

customer_reviews.title: EASY TO ASSEMBLE, GREAT DIRECTIONS. VERY VERY STURDY
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for family get togethers. Covid dictates most gatherings need to be outside. Luckily I have a large yard. This set went up easily and is very well manufactured. Poles are very sturdy. Support strings are my only issue. They are fraying slightly. The sturdiness of the poles far outweighs the support strings. The net is also a great quality. I anticipate many years of frequent use.
customer_reviews.author: SUE WEBB

customer_reviews.title: Don’t play too rough
customer_reviews.text: Nice addition to my back yard, does what it should but still has some issues. The installation wasn’t super easy since you're supposed to dig a large hole and fill it with cement. Also, if you play too rough, the nut that holds the loop for the rope unscrews and the ball comes off. Other than that its really good.
customer_reviews.author: cool guy777

customer_reviews.title: I am not happy and my son still has not really got to ...
customer_reviews.text: The bolt that holds the ball on the tube keeps coming off. I have visited the hardware store and had to buy new bolts and hooks. I am not happy and my son still has not really got to play with his birthday present.
customer_reviews.author: Judi Tabb

customer_reviews.title: Was only 1 pole with it. Send the other poles
customer_reviews.text: sent with one pole. Its useless. Came with just the pole in the middle of the pic and the ball. Nothing else. Please send the rest of it. Too late to send it back so I'm stuck with a useless ball and 1 pole.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy C.

customer_reviews.title: Broke right away
customer_reviews.text: After two games the wire apparatus that is On the ball that attaches to the rope broke. Tried superglue by it didn’t hold. Little kids playing with this so they can’t even hit the ball very hard. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Linda L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Broken right out of the box. Horrible quality do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: Awful. I bought this when it was super expensive for the quality. The rope right out of the box after unraveling it was already pulled or something to where the rope was unraveling and thinning out. I went to attach the clip on and as I raised the pole the ball falls of the unraveled rope.... horrible quality not worth it. You’re paying for broken things... good luck even trying to get a return on this... I emailed them twice and still no response... horrible customer service... this was back in December... before this virus hit...
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last 24 hours
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased as a gift for my soon to be 8 year old daughter, she loves tether ball. My husband assembled and set it up fairly quickly with ease and within 1 day the rope had broken and frayed and made a giant mess all over the backyard. Then the pole completely bent to one side. Wouldn't suggest purchasing, more hassle than it's worth. Plus the new 8 year old is sad.
customer_reviews.author: Rhena Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Ball is not connected properly and broke
customer_reviews.text: The pool is fine it seems to work well but after only playing with the ball with my kids for 25 minutes the ball broken came off the rope and I see it was not a touch properly now I have to buy another one save your money and buy a ball and a better ball separately
customer_reviews.author: E. adler

customer_reviews.title: Terribly made
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product. My 3.5 yr old and 7 yr old niece were playing and rope started fraying, kept coming detached from the pole. The entire pole sways even cemented in the ground. The pole is in 3 pieces which is why it sways. Do not recommend anyone of any age with this product
customer_reviews.author: Dana Coleson

customer_reviews.title: Inadequate material.
customer_reviews.text: Our 10 year old grandaughter didnt finish one game before the pipe bent over and broke. We followed installation and assembly instructions. Inadequate wall thickness on pipe. Would not recomend.
customer_reviews.author: Penny M. Domingos

customer_reviews.title: A Best Buy!
customer_reviews.text: This set is well built and easy to disassemble for the winter.

customer_reviews.title: Ball broke after 2 uses
customer_reviews.text: So I dug the hole, poured the concrete, set it all up and after the second time using it, the metal piece in the ball that connects to the rope pulled out of the ball. This is no longer able to be used. Cheap ball. Not worth the money!!!

customer_reviews.title: fun and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: you will likely need to reinforce your foundation with cement, but this is a legit tetherball set, easy to use and set up, quality product

customer_reviews.title: Loved it!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for the kids to get out and play! We live in a neighborhood so we dont need balls flying everywhere towards the neighbors houses. This is great! Very sturdy and easy to assemble.

I dont know how adults would ever be able to play without it breaking right away. Then when we went to return it, it said we missed the window for a return.

product_meta.title: Baden Champions Series Tetherball Set
product_meta.description: Bring home a piece of elementary school nostalgia with Baden’s Champions Series Tetherball Set. This regulation size portable tetherball set comes with everything needed to bring home a piece of the schoolyard with you. This backyard game set comes packaged with a detachable white steel powder-coated pole which stands fully assembled at (10’ 5”), (1) 100% rubber schoolyard quality tetherball, air pump with hidden needle just in case you need to top the ball off, a durable nylon rope and eyebolt that quickly attaches to the pole, and a (12-inch) ground sleeve to set the pole in with cement (cement not included). Baden strives to produce the highest quality yard games on the planet, and we have spared no exception with this tetherball set. If you’re looking to bring home some a quality yard game look no further.
feature_bullets: SET INCLUDES - (1) White steel powder-coated heavy-duty tetherball pole, (1) Baden Deluxe Tetherball, (1) Nylon rope with hook and eyebolt, (1) Air pump w/needle, and (1) 12-inch PVC plastic ground sleeve
BUILT TOUGH - Weather and rust-resistant pole; designed for outdoor use. School quality 100% rubber Baden tetherball, both were built to withstand spirited play

EASY SETUP - Start playing tetherball in no time - Click the 3 lengths of the pole together, pump up the ball, and you have yourself a game. Assembled height is (10’5”). Requires cement, not included.
FUN FOR EVERYONE - Get the whole family together for hours of old school tetherball fun. Kids of all ages, and adults alike, are quickly caught up in this easy-to-learn game
UNPLUG AND UNWIND - No need to convince your kids to unglue themselves from the tv and their tablets - the lure of tetherball will draw them (and you) outdoors for hours of play

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
